title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: A brief overview of the basic conservation equations in heat transfer and fluid flow, classification of partial differential equations and physical behaviour, role of initial and boundary conditions. Common methods of discretisation: an overview of finite difference, finite elememt and finite volume methods and their relative merits and demerits in solving heat transfer and fluid flow problems. The Finite Volume Method for diffusion, convection-diffusion, and fluid flow problems. Examples with single phase flows in manufacturing processes. Phase Change problems in materials processing and their CFD modeling. Enthalpy-porosity approach for melting-solidification. Phase-field model. Introduction to turbulence modeling and its application in materials processing (such as continuous casting). CFD for laser aided materials processing.
